Topic.Title: IBM latest pension cut hits older employees hardest.....again.

Message.Msg: Not true. When IBM changed from defined to cash, some employees chose to stay with the defined with no further contributions with a company enhanced contribution to the 401k. This change means that enhancement will lose the benefit of growth for an entire year. That is a pension cut. Bottom line, if IBM wasn't saving money, they would not do it.

Topic.Title: This excellent know it all nailed IBM before everyone.

Message.Title: Will Obamacare Spark the Next Tech Boom?
Message.Msg: Seventeen states and the District of Columbia have begun the process of setting up their own exchanges. IBM has won work on building out exchanges for Maryland and Minnesota. http://www.cnbc.com/id/100315355

Topic.Title: IBM latest pension cut hits older employees hardest.....again.

Message.Msg: this is not a pension cut. If anything , its deferring 401 k contributions until the end of a given year. Has nothing to do with the PENSION.
